content.question: According to a recent survey, 81 percent of adults in a certain state have graduated from high school. If 15 adults from the state are selected at random, what is the probability that 5 of them have not graduated from high school?

choices.label: <math alttext="20 choose 15, times 0.19 raised to the 15 power, times 0.81 raised to the fifth power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.19</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.81</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine relative frequencies, proportions, or probabilities using simulation or calculations.
